stories.title: Zoom Video Communications, Inc. Privacy Litigation

stories.text:
pytest-mongodb https://github.com/mdomke/pytest-mongodb#migration-from-humongous requires 3 variables to be defined in pytest.ini these variables are already used in the code as environment variables. It doesn't make sense to duplicate the code in pytest.ini

I saw that https://pypi.org/project/pytest-env/ let's you define environment variables but this isn't very intelligent since it's only one way. I want it to read and in pytest.ini e.g

[pytest] x=$blah

Are there any packages that can do this?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is there Python package that can read environment variables
The Dark Side of Saying Work Is ‘Like a Family’

stories.text:
We're a bootstrapped SaaS startup that helps you go from code to cloud in a few simple steps (you can use our platform or your own cloud platform).
As we are a team of developers with ZERO marketing experience, we don't know who should we reach out to in a company to sell the product.
Is targeting the tech-leads and senior developers a good idea? We know they most likely are not the people who take the decision but they understand the best what we do and the huge value they get from the product.
stories.title: Ask HN: Who takes the decision about buying a SaaS product in small companies?
